radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal-sized liver with mild steatosis and splenomegaly (16 cm in sagittal diameter), no gallstones, biliary-duct dilatation, or evidence of cholecystitis.
Sludge-filled gallbladder with wall thickening and pericholecystic fluid.
Gallbladder wall thickening, irregularity, associated pericholecystic fluid, moderate amount of dependent sludge in the gallbladder, fatty infiltration of the liver and splenomegaly noted.
Hepatomegaly with fatty liver infiltration and splenomegaly (16 cm in sagittal diameter), no gallstones.
Showed Pappenheimer bodies (iron-containing granules), no spur cells, schistocytes, or spherocytes.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Peripheral-blood smear obtained 7 months later showed multiple spherocytes.
